verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> visited<WH6485> Sarah<WH8283> as he had said,<WH559> and the LORD<WH3068> did<WH6213> to Sarah<WH8283> as he had spoken.<WH1696>
For Sarah<WH8283> conceived,<WH2029> and bore<WH3205> Abraham<WH85> a son<WH1121> in his old<WH2208> age, at the set<WH4150> time of which<WH834> God<WH430> had spoken<WH1696> to him.
And Abraham<WH85> called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of his son<WH1121> that was born<WH3205> to him, whom<WH834> Sarah<WH8283> bore<WH3205> to him, Isaac.<WH3327>
And Abraham<WH85> circumcised<WH4135> his son<WH1121> Isaac<WH3327> being eight<WH8083> days<WH3117> old,<WH1121> as God<WH430> had commanded<WH6680> him.
And Abraham<WH85> was an hundred<WH3967> years<WH8141> old,<WH1121> when his son<WH1121> Isaac<WH3327> was born<WH3205> to him.
And Sarah<WH8283> said,<WH559> God<WH430> has made me to laugh,<WH6712> so that all<WH3605> that hear<WH8085> will laugh<WH6711> with me.

And she said,<WH4448> Who<WH4310> would have said<WH4448> to Abraham,<WH85> that Sarah<WH8283> should have given children<WH1121> suck?<WH3243> for I have born<WH3205> him a son<WH1121> in his old<WH2208> age.
And the child<WH3206> grew,<WH1431> and was weaned:<WH1580> and Abraham<WH85> made<WH6213> a great<WH1419> feast<WH4960> the same day<WH3117> that Isaac<WH3327> was weaned.<WH1580>
And Sarah<WH8283> saw<WH7200> the son<WH1121> of Hagar<WH1904> the Egyptian,<WH4713> which<WH834> she had born<WH3205> to Abraham,<WH85> mocking.<WH6711>

Why she said<WH559> to Abraham,<WH85> Cast<WH1644> out this<WH2063> female slave<WH519> and her son:<WH1121> for the son<WH1121> of this<WH2063> female slave<WH519> shall not be heir<WH3423> with my son, even with Isaac.<WH3327>
And the thing<WH1697> was very<WH3966> grievous<WH7489> in Abraham's<WH85> sight<WH5869> because<WH2921> <WH182> of his son.<WH1121>

And God<WH430> said<WH559> to Abraham,<WH85> Let it not be grievous<WH7489> in your sight<WH5869> because<WH5921> of the lad,<WH5288> and because<WH5921> of your female slave;<WH519> in all<WH3605> that Sarah<WH8283> has said<WH559> to you, listen<WH8085> to her voice;<WH6963> for in Isaac<WH3327> shall your seed<WH2233> be called.<WH7121>
And also of the son<WH1121> of the female slave<WH519> will I make<WH7760> a nation,<WH1471> because<WH3588> he is your seed.<WH2233>

And Abraham<WH85> rose<WH7925> up early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH1242> and took<WH3947> bread,<WH3899> and a bottle<WH2573> of water,<WH4325> and gave<WH5414> it to Hagar,<WH1904> putting<WH7760> it on<WH5921> her shoulder,<WH7926> and the child,<WH3206> and sent<WH7971> her away: and she departed,<WH3212> and wandered<WH8582> in the wilderness<WH4057> of Beersheba.<WH884>
And the water<WH4325> was spent<WH3615> in the bottle,<WH2573> and she cast<WH7993> the child<WH3206> under<WH8478> one<WH259> of the shrubs.<WH7880>

And she went,<WH3212> and sat<WH3427> her down over<WH5048> against<WH5048> him a good<WH7368> way off, as it were a bow shot:<WH2909> <WH7198> for she said,<WH559> Let me not see<WH7200> the death<WH4194> of the child.<WH3206> And she sat<WH3427> over<WH5048> against<WH5048> him, and lift<WH5375> up her voice,<WH6963> and wept.<WH1058>

And God<WH430> heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of the lad;<WH5288> and the angel<WH4397> of God<WH430> called<WH7121> to Hagar<WH1904> out of heaven,<WH8064> and said<WH559> to her, What<WH4100> ails you, Hagar?<WH1904> fear<WH3372> not; for God<WH430> has heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of the lad<WH5288> where<WH834> he is.
Arise,<WH6965> lift<WH5375> up the lad,<WH5288> and hold<WH2388> him in your hand;<WH3027> for I will make<WH7760> him a great<WH1419> nation.<WH1471>

And God<WH430> opened<WH6491> her eyes,<WH5869> and she saw<WH7200> a well<WH875> of water;<WH4325> and she went,<WH3212> and filled<WH4390> the bottle<WH2573> with water,<WH4325> and gave the lad<WH5288> drink.<WH8248>
And God<WH430> was with the lad;<WH5288> and he grew,<WH1431> and dwelled<WH3427> in the wilderness,<WH4057> and became<WH1961> an archer.<WH7198>
And he dwelled<WH3427> in the wilderness<WH4057> of Paran:<WH6290> and his mother<WH517> took<WH3947> him a wife<WH802> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And it came<WH1961> to pass at that time,<WH6256> that Abimelech<WH40> and Phichol<WH6369> the chief captain<WH8269> of his host<WH6635> spoke<WH559> to Abraham,<WH85> saying,<WH559> God<WH430> is with you in all<WH3605> that you do:<WH6213>

Now<WH6258> therefore swear<WH7650> to me here<WH2008> by God<WH430> that you will not deal falsely<WH8266> with me, nor with my son,<WH5220> nor with my son's<WH5220> son:<WH5220> but according to the kindness<WH2617> that I have done<WH6213> to you, you shall do<WH6213> to me, and to the land<WH776> wherein<WH834> you have sojourned.<WH1481>
And Abraham<WH85> said,<WH559> I will swear.<WH7650>
And Abraham<WH85> reproved<WH3198> Abimelech<WH40> because<WH5921> <WH182> of a well<WH875> of water,<WH4325> which<WH834> Abimelech's<WH40> servants<WH5650> had violently<WH1497> taken<WH1497> away.

And Abimelech<WH40> said,<WH559> I know<WH3045> not who<WH4310> has done<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing;<WH1697> neither<WH3808> did you tell<WH5046> me, neither<WH3808> yet<WH1571> heard<WH8085> I of it, but to day.<WH3117>
And Abraham<WH85> took<WH3947> sheep<WH6629> and oxen,<WH1241> and gave<WH5414> them to Abimelech;<WH40> and both<WH8147> of them made<WH3772> a covenant.<WH1285>
And Abraham<WH85> set<WH5324> seven<WH7651> ewe<WH3535> lambs<WH3535> of the flock<WH6629> by themselves.
And Abimelech<WH40> said<WH559> to Abraham,<WH85> What<WH4100> mean these seven<WH7651> ewe<WH3535> lambs<WH3535> which<WH834> you have set<WH5324> by themselves?
And he said,<WH559> For these seven<WH7651> ewe<WH3535> lambs<WH3535> shall you take<WH3947> of my hand,<WH3027> that they may be a witness<WH5713> to me, that I have dig<WH2658> this well.<WH875>
Why<WH5921> <WH3651> he called<WH7121> that place<WH4725> Beersheba;<WH884> because<WH3588> there<WH8033> they swore<WH7650> both<WH8147> of them.

Thus they made<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> at Beersheba:<WH884> then Abimelech<WH40> rose<WH6965> up, and Phichol<WH6369> the chief captain<WH8269> of his host,<WH6635> and they returned<WH7725> into<WH413> the land<WH776> of the Philistines.<WH6430>
And Abraham<WH85> planted<WH5193> a grove<WH815> in Beersheba,<WH884> and called<WH7121> there<WH8033> on the name<WH8034> of the LORD,<WH3068> the everlasting<WH5769> God.<WH410>
And Abraham<WH85> sojourned<WH1481> in the Philistines' <WH6430>land<WH776> many<WH7227> days.<WH3117>
